capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just reading about Minerva McGonagall and it's interesting to note that she is an adult. I mean, she's been around for a pretty long time, even if she does look younger than some of the other professors at Hogwarts. Anyway, I think it's great that J.K. Rowling chose to make her an adult character - it really adds depth to her personality and backstory.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always had a lot of respect for Professor McGonagall. She's an amazing educator and an even more impressive witch. As the Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts, she's played a significant role in shaping many young minds, including mine. Her affiliation with the school is truly admirable, and I think that's one of the reasons why she's so well-liked by everyone who knows her.
